keyMoments.title: Asking Zoro to Be Big Brother
keyMoments.description: Michael and his friend Hoichael persistently follow Zoro through Water 7, asking him to become their 'Big Brother' and join their orphan family.
keyMoments.significance: Initiates the episode's main plot and shows Michael's persistence and desire for a strong older brother figure.

keyMoments.title: Bringing Zoro to the Orphanage
keyMoments.description: Michael brings Zoro to his home at Aunt's orphanage, introducing him to their adoptive family.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Michael's home life and his relationship with his adoptive mother and siblings.

relationships.description: Michael's best friend and fellow orphan who shares his adventures.

evolutionMoments.description: The two work together to convince Zoro to join their family.

relationships.description: Michael's adoptive mother who runs the orphanage.

evolutionMoments.description: Michael helps with household work and respects Aunt as his mother.

relationships.description: Michael admires Zoro and wants him to be his Big Brother.

evolutionMoments.description: Michael persistently follows Zoro and convinces him to help their family.

reveals.information: Lives in Aunt's orphanage in Water 7
Idolizes Franky and uses his motto 'Mm, super!!'

keyMoments.title: Asking Zoro to Be Big Brother
keyMoments.description: Hoichael and his friend Michael persistently follow Zoro through Water 7, asking him to become their 'Big Brother' and join their orphan family.
keyMoments.significance: Initiates the episode's main plot and shows Hoichael's persistence and desire for a strong older brother figure.

keyMoments.title: Seeking Help from Zoro
keyMoments.description: Hoichael finds Zoro and asks for his help when loan sharks kidnap their family.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Hoichael's trust in Zoro and leads to the episode's climax.

relationships.description: Hoichael's best friend and fellow orphan who shares his adventures.

evolutionMoments.description: The two work together to convince Zoro to join their family.

relationships.description: Hoichael's adoptive mother who runs the orphanage.

evolutionMoments.description: Hoichael helps with household work and respects Aunt as his mother.

relationships.description: Hoichael admires Zoro and wants him to be his Big Brother.

evolutionMoments.description: Hoichael seeks Zoro's help when his family is in danger.

reveals.information: Lives in Aunt's orphanage in Water 7
Has sparse hair on top and missing teeth

keyMoments.title: Introduction of Aunt
keyMoments.description: Aunt is introduced as the caretaker of an orphanage in Water 7, treating her orphaned children as her own biological family.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Aunt as a mother figure character who parallels other adoptive parents in One Piece like Bell-mère.
keyMoments.quote: These children are my real family, even without blood relation.

keyMoments.title: Putting Zoro to Work
keyMoments.description: Aunt tricks Zoro into staying at the orphanage and assigns him various household chores and babysitting duties.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Aunt's stubborn yet well-intentioned personality and creates the episode's comedic situations.

keyMoments.title: Threatened by Loan Sharks
keyMoments.description: Aunt and her family are threatened by loan sharks demanding money, leading to a kidnapping situation.
keyMoments.significance: Creates the episode's central conflict and demonstrates the dangers facing Aunt's family.

keyMoments.title: Releasing Zoro
keyMoments.description: After Zoro saves her family, Aunt recognizes that he belongs with the Straw Hat Pirates and releases him from his obligation to be their Big Brother.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Aunt's wisdom and understanding, concluding the episode's emotional arc about family and belonging.
keyMoments.quote: You belong with your real family, the Straw Hats.

abilities.description: Aunt spins rapidly while charging at opponents with her carpet beaters.

relationships.description: Aunt treats Michael as her own son despite no blood relation.

evolutionMoments.description: Aunt protects Michael and the other orphans from loan sharks.

relationships.description: Aunt treats Hoichael as her own son despite no blood relation.

evolutionMoments.description: Aunt protects Hoichael and the other orphans from loan sharks.

relationships.description: Aunt briefly considers Zoro as her oldest son, but ultimately recognizes his true loyalty lies with the Straw Hats.

evolutionMoments.description: Aunt tricks Zoro into helping with housework, then releases him to rejoin his crew.

reveals.information: Believes family is defined by love and care, not blood relations
Runs an orphanage in Water 7, caring for homeless children
Demonstrates surprising physical strength and acrobatic skills despite her size

keyMoments.title: Mikazuki Confronts Zoro
keyMoments.description: Mikazuki, a swordsman hired by loan sharks, appears and boasts about his 36 million berry bounty before challenging Zoro.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces the episode's main antagonist and sets up the climactic battle.
keyMoments.quote: I have a 36 million berry bounty!

keyMoments.title: Defeated by Zoro
keyMoments.description: Despite his confidence, Mikazuki is easily defeated by Zoro along with the other loan sharks.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the vast difference in power between Zoro and East Blue-level pirates, even those with bounties.

abilities.description: Mikazuki is a swordsman, though his skills are vastly inferior to Zoro's.

reveals.information: Works as a hired mercenary for loan sharks

keyMoments.title: Searching for Sword Repair
keyMoments.description: Zoro attempts to find a sword shop that can repair his damaged Yubashiri but is rejected by multiple shops.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Zoro's continued concern about his damaged weapon from the Enies Lobby battle.

keyMoments.title: Doing Housework
keyMoments.description: Zoro struggles with household chores and babysitting, showing his complete incompetence in domestic matters.
keyMoments.significance: Provides comedy by showing Zoro completely out of his element, contrasting his warrior persona with domestic duties.

keyMoments.title: Defeating Loan Sharks
keyMoments.description: Zoro easily defeats all the loan sharks and Mikazuki to protect Aunt's orphanage.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Zoro's strength and his willingness to protect those in need, even temporary acquaintances.

relationships.description: Robin discovers Zoro with the orphan family but keeps his secret.

evolutionMoments.description: Robin shows understanding and discretion by not teasing Zoro about his domestic situation.

reveals.information: Completely incompetent at household chores and babysitting
Willing to help those in need despite his gruff exterior
